net.proteusframework.ui.miwt

Class MonitorDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.Device
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.MonitorDevice

  • public class MonitorDevice
extends Device
    Device model of a monitor whose dimensions are defined by pixels and there is a DPI.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MonitorDevice(int width, int height)
      Construct a new MonitorDevice with the given pixel dimensions.
      MonitorDevice(int width, int height, double dpi)
      Construct a new MonitorDevice with the given pixel dimensions and DPI for both the width and height.
      MonitorDevice(int width, int height, double dpiWidth, double dpiHeight)
      Construct a new MonitorDevice with the given pixel dimensions and DPI values for the width and height.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.Device

        getDeviceMetric, setDeviceMetric

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonitorDevice

        public MonitorDevice(int width,
             int height)
        Construct a new MonitorDevice with the given pixel dimensions. The DPI is assumed to be 75.
        Parameters:
        width - The width in pixels.
        height - The height in pixels.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the width or height are less than or equal to zero.

      • MonitorDevice

        public MonitorDevice(int width,
             int height,
             double dpi)
        Construct a new MonitorDevice with the given pixel dimensions and DPI for both the width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - The width in pixels.
        height - The height in pixels.
        dpi - The DPI.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dpi<=0, or if the width or height are less than or equal to zero.

      • MonitorDevice

        public MonitorDevice(int width,
             int height,
             double dpiWidth,
             double dpiHeight)
        Construct a new MonitorDevice with the given pixel dimensions and DPI values for the width and height.
        Parameters:
        width - The width in pixels.
        height - The height in pixels.
        dpiWidth - The DPI for the width.
        dpiHeight - The DPI for the height.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either DPI<=0, or if the width or height are less than or equal to zero.
